label: Description
value: Two alphabets at the top (missing the letter J) and three narrow pattern bands, followed by a rococo frame containing examples of various stitches, and enclosing a floral spray and the date 1799. With initials and figures of animals at the edge.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation Technique: embroidered in cross, stem, chain, eye, four-sided, rococo, knot, satin, roumanian, and running stitches on plain weave foundation

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection

label: Description
value: Two alphabets at the top (missing the letter J) divided by narrow bands of pattern, then a rococo frame enclosing scattered flowers and the inscription: Vivat MD WD, with initials and animal figures at the sides.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation Technique: embroidered in cross, stem, satin, knot, chain, eye, four-sided canvas, rococo, herringbone, and half cross stitches on plain weave foundation

label: Provenance
value: Ex. coll. Fraser-Martin. Purchased at R.H. Macy & Co.

label: Credit line

label: Description
value: A cornucopia is spilling an assortment of flowers; it is surrounded by butterflies and birds. An estucheon below the cornucopia is inscribed Jamesscoll (?) for W.L. Kenney, Nov. 1, 1796,  and an inscription appears in the lower left corner: Worked by Elizabeth Mercer, Nov. 1- 25 1796. With a traliling floral vine border on all sides. The fabric has been pieced: the field and borders are not of the same foundation fabric.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation Technique: embroidered in chain, feather, couching, stem, and satin stitches on plain weave foundation

label: Provenance
value: Ex. coll. Fraser/Martin. Bought from a friend of Mrs. Wiltbank, Boston 1922. Her grandmother's sampler.  Donor note: Bought in Boston 1922 from friend of Mrs. Wilkbank, her grandmother's sampler.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection

label: Description
value: Figures of a man and woman in an arbor with the initials K.S. and the date 1753, and motifs symmetrically arranged, including a pair of confronted rabbits at the bottom and crouching stags on each side. On a blue cross-stitched background.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation Technique: embroidered in counted cross and eye stitches on plain weave foundation

label: Provenance
value: Ex. coll. Fraser-Martin. Elizabeth Stuart sale, Philadelphia, cat. #44, American Art Galleries, New York, 1924.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection

label: Description
value: Square carrying cloth (furoshiki) with the design of a bundle of seaweed and a flowering branch in the center of a blue-green ground. Light blue crest in one corner. Three pieces of fabric sewn together, the outer two selvage to selvage widths, joined prior to dyeing. The linear pattern is achieved by a resist paste. Four corner reinforced by three rows of running stitches radiating from the corner. Two sides reinforced by double row of running stitches. Top and bottoms hemmed. Small tassel at each corner.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: flat surface resist on plain weave

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of Textiles Fund

label: Description
value: All over middle grey tone created by a tiny dot pattern created by a resist supplied through a stencil. Fabric dyed dark blue. A crest appears on each shoulder on the front and center of shoulders at back. Kimono is unlined and the fabric is double faced.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: resist printed with a stencil on plain weave

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of Textiles Fund

label: Description
value: Man's coat made from two layers of cotton fabric, dyed dark indigo blue on the outside and lighter blue on the inside, quilted in running stitches using a medium blue cotton thread. The quilting pattern on the sleeve is a swastika fret, and on the body a diagonal herringbone.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: quilted plain weave

value: Museum purchase from Friends of Textiles Fund

label: Description
value:
Bands of alphabets and numerals, 1797, then a record of the births in the Eaton family:
Job Eaton born May 26 1762/1765
Phebe Eaton born December 20
Sarah Eaton born November 22 1786
Job Eaton born January 21 1789
Moses Eaton born March 18 1791
Hannah Eaton born March 15 1793
Jonathan M. Eaton born June 10 1794
Hanna Eaton born January 27 1797
Ezra B. Eaton born August 24 1799
Wocester Eaton born December 17 1801

Bottom portion is incomplete. The sampler was begun in 1797, and added to in the early 19th century

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation Technique: embroidered in counted cross, eye, and satin stitches on plain weave foundation

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection

label: Description
value: Coverlet has a design of flowers in octagons covering the central field with a tree and floral vine border. Colors are red, dark blue, green and yellow. Woven inscription reads: "Made by C. Wiamn Allentown 1843."

label: Description
value: Beiderwand-style coverlet has flowers in octagons covering the central field with a plant border. Colors are red, light blue, and dark blue. Woven inscription reads: "Made by Peter Seibert, Easton 1854."

label: Description
value: Summer and Winter-style coverlet has a star and flower pattern covering the central field with a rose border. Colors are red and white. Woven inscription reads: "Made by H. Haeseler, Orwigsburg, Property of -----, 1848."

label: Description
value: Small scale floral octagon pattern in the field and no border. Red, dark blue and green. Two lengths stitched together with weft fringe.

label: Description
value: Overshot coverlet in rust red, blue-green and tan, made of two lengths stitched together.

label: Description
value: Two alternating floral vine pattern stripes, three-quarters of an inch wide, one gold and the other silver on a red-purple background.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: discontinuous supplementary wefts floating from face to face in a 3/1 twill foundation

label: Description
value: Circular stained glass panel depicting a man dressed in red with a white cross emblazoned on chest, holding a pickaxe, above a circular formation filled with red and white plumes, two Greek crosses on a background of red, and an ax. This is flanked by two white and gold columns that stand before blue doors on a checkered floor.

label: Provenance
value: The C. Helme and Alice B. Strater Collection; 1976: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the C. Helme and Alice B. Strater Collection

label: Description
value: Rectangular stained glass panel depicting a well-dressed couple (marriage portrait?); he holds a two-pronged scepter and the woman holds a gold goblet in one hand. Below them, a wreathed oval showing a winged angel behind a gold pulpit with a white arrowhead pointing up. Above the couple, red escutcheon with angel head. Above this, landscape scene of horses and oxen pulling as a man plows. Text below.

label: Provenance
value: The C. Helme and Alice B. Strater Collection; 1976: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the C. Helme and Alice B. Strater Collection

label: Description
value: Rectangular stained glass panel depicting in grisaille, a standing man dressed in armor and red boots, holding a spear in one hand and the other hand on hilt of sword at his side, under a blue and red arch with green pilasters and decorative columns. Next to him, a shield, arrows, and plumes. Flanking him are two bright beet-colored pedestals topped with green finials; behind him, blue stairs. Hanging above is an escutcheon: “1564”. Behind the shield, a man stands holding one black arrow pointing up and a white arrow pointing down. Above this, a hunting scene unfolds depicting a man on horseback and two other men on foot, following a stag, with several dogs.

label: Provenance
value: The C. Helme and Alice B. Strater Collection; 1976: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the C. Helme and Alice B. Strater Collection

label: Description
value: Rectangular stained glass panel depicting a well-dressed couple; with one hand, man pulls a cord with tassel, and woman holds a gold goblet. Possible wedding portrait. Above couple, an oval crest showing two black bears flanking a yellow pine tree, between two scenes. On left: men dining and drinking (celebrating), on right: standing musicians. Below, left, a gold shield crest featuring a black symbol of a cross, star and crescent conjoined. To the right, an inscription: “Clausskunklibzi” [?]
